name: ineptitude
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of not being skilled or effective: political/social/economic ineptitude It was not angry bloggers that rendered the website inaccessible, but sheer technological ineptitude. See
inept
More examplesFewer examplesHe was forced from office after a year for ineptitude and corruption.You couldn't fail to be angry at the sheer waste and gross ineptitude.The problems were public indifference, bureaucratic ineptitude, and corporate incompetence.
